content:
• Friday, December 7, 2018
  • TPR

    TPR, NNN and LYB among after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: TPR +6.5%. LAZ +5.4%. LYB +5.1%. BRFS +4.9%. PVH +4.7%.
    • Top Losers: ACOR -2.9%. UXIN -2.5%. NNN -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 12 Comments
  • MGNX

    FDA suspends enrollment in clinical studies of MacroGenics' MGD009 on safety signal

    • The FDA has instituted a partial clinical hold on two clinical trials evaluating MacroGenics' (NASDAQ:MGNX) bispecific DART molecule MGD009 due to due potential liver effects, including elevated liver enzymes with or without concurrent elevations in bilirubin. The company says the effects have been uncomplicated and short in duration. It plans to amend the protocols to include additional care to address the events.
    • A partial clinical hold means that no new patients may be enrolled but those already in the studies may continue receiving treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • QDEL

    Quidel loses bid to stop Beckman from directly selling BNP assay; shares down 19%

    • Thinly traded Quidel (QDEL -18.7%) is down on modestly higher volume, albeit on turnover of only 299K shares, in response to the news that Beckman has prevailed in a lawsuit related to the sale of test called B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP). The company owns exclusive rights to sell the test, called Triage BNP, on Beckman Coulter analyzers but Beckman wants to sell the test directly to its customers. The California court intends to enter an order allowing Beckman to do just that.
    • Quidel says the litigation is broader that this one issue and it expects to ultimately prevail. The trial remains scheduled for August 30, 2019.
    • The situation arose from Abbott's takeout of Alere more than a year ago. The BNP rights were in-licensed by BioSite Diagnostics in late 1996. BioSite was subsequently acquired by Alere (then d/b/a Inverness Medical Innovations). In order to satisfy antitrust concerns with the Abbott tie-up, Alere sold its Triage MeterPro and Triage BNP lines to Quidel.
    • Quidel's Cardiac Immunoassay sales, which include Triage and Beckman BNP, accounted for 52% ($203.6M/$389.7) of 2018 ytd sales.
    • Previously: Quidel down 14% on Beckman move to sell BNP assay directly (Nov. 27, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    Airlines in broad selloff; Wolfe Research sees cloudy skies ahead for sector

    • Airline stocks are plunging, with the sector on track to suffer its biggest one-day loss since February 2016, slammed by the recent weakness in oil prices and concerns over a slowing economy.
    • Wolfe Research downgrades the airline sector to Underweight from Overweight, saying that while a recession and lower oil are both "toxic" for air carriers, "we trust airlines to react better to a recession than we trust them not to behave poorly with lower oil prices."
    • While the airlines have made changes to better position themselves in downturns, the industry’s poor track record looms large, Wolfe's Hunter Keay says, adding that while investors can hope that the next recession will allow carriers to prove they’ve learned lessons, the best place to watch is from the sidelines.
    • Among individual names, Keay cuts American Airlines (AAL -9%), Hawaiian Holdings (HA -9.4%) and Spirit Airlines (SAVE -8.3%) to Peer Perform from Outperform, and JetBlue (JBLU -5.6%) and WestJet (OTC:WJAFF -3%) to Underperform from Peer Perform.
    • But Keay reiterates his Outperform rating on Delta Air Lines (DAL -3.8%) and upgrades Southwest Airlines (LUV -4.1%) to Outperform from Peer Perform; he likes DAL’s variable cost structure and strong balance sheet and margins, and he thinks LUV's track record means the stock is one of the better airlines to invest in during a downturn.
    • ETF: JETS
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 69 Comments
  • DOMO

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 PM

    • Gainers: Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) +27%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) +26%. Qualstar Corporation (NASDAQ:QBAK) +21%. Innodata (NASDAQ:INOD) +15%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +14%.
    • Losers: SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) -20%. Coupa Software Incorporated (NASDAQ:COUP) -12%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -10%. Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) -10%. Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • BASFY

    BASF -4% after cutting 2018 profit outlook, now seen falling 15%-20%

    • BASF (OTCQX:BASFY -4.3%) turns sharply lower after cutting its FY 2018 profit forecast, blaming most of the decline on weakness in its chemicals segment, where prices for isocyanate - used in making polyurethane polymers and foams - and steam cracker margins were lower than expected.
    • BASF says it now expects full-year adjusted EBIT to decline by 15%-20% from last year’s 7.6B ($8.6B), compared to an earlier forecast of a 10% drop.
    • The company, based on the Rhine, expects the low water level of the river during Q4 will lead to negative earnings impacts of up to EUR200M, higher than previously forecast; in Q3, the negative earnings impact from the low water level could be limited to ~EUR50M.
    • Also, BASF says its business with the automotive industry has continued to decline, with demand from customers in China slowing significantly, which the company says has been hurt by the trade conflict between the U.S. and China.
    • Chemical stocks are broadly lower: TSE -7.3%, HUN -4.3%, DWDP -4.1%, ASH -4%, CE -3.4%, LYB -3.3%, WLKP -3.2%, EMN -3.1%, WLK -2.7%, PPG -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 33 Comments
  • CLMT

    Calumet Specialty Products Partners and Genie Energy among Energy/Materials gainers; Ferrellgas Partners and Emerge Energy Services among losers

    • Gainers: Calumet Specialty Products Partners (NASDAQ:CLMT) +9%. Genie Energy (NYSE:GNE) +8%. VAALCO Energy (NYSE:EGY) +7%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) +7%. Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) +7%.
    • Losers: Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP) -12%. Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) -7%. Covia (NYSE:CVIA) -6%. Venator Materials PLC (NYSE:VNTR) -6%. Tantech (NASDAQ:TANH) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ACB

    Aurora Cannabis to enter Mexico; shares up 9%

    • Nano cap Aurora Cannabis (ACB +9.1%) is up on modestly higher volume on the heels of its announcement that it will enter the Mexican market via an exclusive partnership with local drug maker Farmacias Magistrales S.A.
    • Farmacias has secured licenses from regulators for the importation and storage of raw cannabidiol (CBD) and THC materials and the manufacture and distribution of CBD- and THC-containing products.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 84 Comments
  • EOG

    EOG Resources +2% on oil rally, J.P. Morgan upgrade

    • EOG Resources (EOG +2.1%) rides today's energy rally to a healthy gain, helped too by a J.P. Morgan upgrade to Overweight from Neutral with a $118 price target.
    • JPM analyst Arun Jayaram reshuffled his ratings for the large-cap E&P segment to reflect changes in the macro environment, and he likes EOG's defensive characteristics and expects the shares to outperform the peer group assuming oil prices remain near strip levels.
    • Jayaram also likes Permian producers Anadarko Petroleum (APC +0.8%), Cabot Oil & Gas (COG), Concho Resources (CXO +1.2%), Marathon Oil (MRO -0.7%) and Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD), believing the companies are "solidly positioned over the long term" although he expects "significant pressure on estimates."
    • At the same time, the firm downgrades Chesapeake Energy and Devon Energy, but those stocks also are higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 5 Comments
  • TENX

    Tenax prices equity offering; shares ahead 38%

    • Ultra-thinly traded Tenax Therapeutics (TENX +38.1%) is up on a whopping 1,614x surge in volume. The company just announced the pricing of its $10M equity offering of 5,181,346 Units at $1.93. Shares were up three-fold before retracing.
    • Each Unit consists of one share of Series A Convertible Preferred Stock, convertible into one share of common at $1.93, one two-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $1.93 and one five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $1.93.
    • Previously: Tenax Therapeutics files for stock offering (Dec. 4)
    • Update: The offering closed on December 11 yielding gross proceeds of ~$10M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • QRVO

    Susquehanna starts Qorvo at Neutral

    • Susquehanna initiates Qorva (NASDAQ:QRVO) with a Neutral rating and a $70 price target.
    • Earlier this week, fellow Apple supplier joined Qorvo and Lumentum in cutting its guidance on soft smartphone demand.
    • Qorvo shares are down 1% to $62.10.
    • Previously: Apple suppliers, chips drop on Cirrus cut (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • ZEN

    Wedbush starts Zendesk at Outperform

    • Wedbush starts Zendesk (ZEN -2.3%) at Outperform with a $71 price target.
    • While the tech sector has had a rocky year between the US-China trade war and Apple iPhone demand fears, cloud stocks have faired better thanks to IBM's $34B Red Hat acquisition and the planned merger between Cloudera and Hortonworks.
    • Zendesk shares are up 4.3% in the past week, 12.3% in the month, and 77% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • OZM

    Och-Ziff Capital Management leads financial gainers; Hexindai and LendingTree among losers

    • Gainers: Och-Ziff Capital Management Group (NYSE:OZM) +18%. CBL & Associates Properties (NYSE:CBL) +6%. Greenhill & Co. (NYSE:GHL) +6%.
    • Losers: Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) -32%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -13%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) -11%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -11%. LendingTree (NASDAQ:TREE) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • PBR

    Reuters: Petrobras nears terms over TAG pipeline sale

    • Petrobras (PBR +2.2%) could present a new sale and purchase agreement before the end of this year for the sale of the Transportadora Associada de Gás pipeline, Reuters reports, after a U.S. Supreme Court injunction in July stalled the sale.
    • The sale of TAG reportedly could fetch as much as $7B, which would make it one of PBR’s largest-ever asset sales.
    • A sale would mark a pullback from the natural gas distribution business for PBR, as the company prioritizes more profitable investments such as Brazil’s deepwater oil and gas exploration and production segments, while divesting midstream assets such as refineries and pipelines, as well as overseas oil fields.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • TENX

    • Gainers: Tenax Therapeutics (NASDAQ:TENX) +129%. Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores (NASDAQ:SHOS) +22%. Cronos Group (NASDAQ:CRON) +22%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) +20%. Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) +20%. VIVUS (NASDAQ:VVUS) +19%. Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) +18%. Och-Ziff Capital Management Group (NYSE:OZM) +18%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +14%. Qualstar Corporation (NASDAQ:QBAK) +15%.

SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) -16%. Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN) -16%. ENDRA Life Sciences (NASDAQ:NDRA) -15%. Oragenics (NYSEMKT:OGEN) -14%. Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) -14%.

  • LULU

    Lululemon leads apparel sector lower

    • Apparel and footwear stocks are trading weak once again, presumably on renewed tariff jitters from investors and some blowback from Lululemon's (LULU -9.7%) disappointing holiday quarter guidance.
    • Notable decliners include VF Corp (NYSE:VFC) -5.3%, Michael Kors (KORS) -5.1%, Fossilk (NASDAQ:FOSL) -5.0%, Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) -4.7%, Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) -4.2%, Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM) -4.0%, PVH(NYSE:PVH) -3.9%, Vince (NYSE:VNCE) -3.7%, Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) -3.6%, Gildan ACtivewear (NYSE:GIL) -2.9%, Columbia SPortswear (NASDAQ:COLM) -2.7%, Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI) -2.6% and Nike (NYSE:NKE) -2.5%.
    • Previously: Lululemon falls 6% despite earnings topper (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 21 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus joins tiny biotechs in the green, up 21%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Vivus (VVUS +21.3%) is up on almost a 6x surge in volume, the latest member of spiking tiny biotechs.
    • The stock is currently exchanging hands at $2.98, well below its quick asset value per share based on Q3 numbers. At the end of September, cash and equivalents and available-for-sale securities totaled $115.1M or $10.83 per share. Operations consumed $26.7M during the first three quarters so, assuming similar cash consumption in Q4, the cash value per share will be ~$10 at year-end.
    • The company is planning to relaunch PANCREAZE next quarter. It also plans to obtain additional regulatory approvals and partners in open territories for STENDRA/SPEDRA and certain territories for QSYMIA (corporate presentation, slide #19).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • AB

    Asset managers avoid the market's downdraft

    • Many asset managers are rising amid the broader market decline.
    • AllianceBernstein (AB +2.5%), Franklin Resources (BEN +1.2%),  and exchange-traded product specialist Wisdom Tree (WETF +1.1%) manage the healthiest gains.
    • Och-Ziff Management (OZM +18.3%) gains after outlining sweeping changes on Thursday that will lead to Dan Och transitioning out of the firm.
    • Not all are up though: BlackRock (BLK -0.2%) and Invesco (IVZ -0.9%) slip.
    • Previously: Skittish markets turn down (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 8 Comments

  • Tech lunch: Huawei woes weigh down Wall Street

    • Tech weighs on Wall Street today, offsetting strong oil prices and a so-so jobs report that was good enough to avoid slowdown fears. The sector is still feeling pressure from the arrest of Huawei's CFO, with its potential to stoke new US-China trade tensions, and concerns about the Apple -2.5% supply chain even as Broadcom +1.3% gains after positive earnings.
    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) and S&P IT Index are down 2.5%, the Nasdaq 100 drops 2.3%, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index drops 2.5%. The Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq are down 1.6%, 1.6%, and 2%, respectively.
    • Related broad tech ETFs: XLK, VGT, TECL, FTEC, IYW, ROM, QTEC, RYT, FNG, TECS, IGM, FXL, XNTK, REW, JHMT, XITK
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 6 Comments
  • TLND

    Talend to acquire Stitch

    • Talend (TLND +5.3%) has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Stitch for $60M in cash (subject to certain transaction adjustments).
    • Stitch offers an easy-to-use service for moving data from popular sources to leading cloud data warehouse platforms.
    • The transaction is expected to close in Q4 and subject to customary closing conditions.
    • “Stitch is a great addition that gives us a compelling offering in the market for simple, self-service integration for cloud data warehouses,” said Mike Tuchen, CEO, Talend. “In addition, we believe Stitch will work as an efficient high-volume way to acquire new cloud customers to whom we can market our advanced cloud solutions for data integration, transformation, cleaning, preparing and cataloging.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAYRY

    Activist investor Elliott takes on Bayer

    • Reuters reports that activist investor Paul Singer's Elliott Management has established a larger stake in Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +0.1%) after owning the stock for more than a year. Mr. Singer has been unable to meet personally with CEO Werner Baumann or one of his colleagues so a more sizeable position, unspecified at this point, may open the executive suite a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 15 Comments
  • CAAS

    China Automotive Systems leads consumer gainers; Eastman Kodak and Lululemon Athletica among losers

    • Gainers: China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) +11%. Thor Industries (NYSE:THO) +6%. SunOpta (NASDAQ:STKL) +6%.
    • Losers: Johnson Outdoors (NASDAQ:JOUT) -18%. Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ:LULU) -8%. Movado Group (NYSE:MOV) -8%. Eastman Kodak (NYSE:KODK) -6%. At Home Group (NASDAQ:HOME) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • PARR

    Par Pacific +3% as Oppenheimer starts coverage at Outperform

    • Par Pacific (PARR +3.1%) is higher as Oppenheimer initiates the stock with an Outperform rating and $22 price target, saying the company's self-described "growth-oriented" profile is supported by "several transformation acquisitions and growth projects underway that are dramatically reshaping the company."
    • Oppenheimer analyst Tim Rezvan notes that what was once a one-off Hawaii refinery with interests in a private E&P should soon be an integrated, three-refinery network processing 170K bbl/day of crude, with estimated $65M of annual logistics EBITDA and $80M of free cash flow per year with mid-cycle crack spreads.
    • The firm also expects the company's acquisitions and "tactical capital investments to optimize revenue opportunities" going forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • AKRX

    Akorn loses appeal of Fresenius exit from merger; shares down 22%

    • Akorn (AKRX -22%) is down on almost quadruple normal volume in response to its failed appeal of Fresenius SE's exit from the now-defunct merger.
    • Previously: Akorn down 7% premarket on slim chances of reviving Fresenius deal (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 13 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy +3% as oil rally outweighs J.P. Morgan downgrade

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.5%) bounces off 10-month lows as today's rally in crude oil prices outweighs J.P. Morgan's downgrade of CHK shares to Underweight from Neutral, citing concerns over near-term headwinds from the company's planned $4B acquisition of WildHorse Resource.
    • While the acquisition, which provided increased oil weightings, was a "necessary step" for CHK in turning the corner on its turnaround plan, "the stock will likely be a 'show me' situation" as investors generally had mixed views on the east Texas Eagle Ford plays, JPM analyst Arun Jayaram says.
    • The firm also issues several other downgrades to reflect the "sharp retrenchment" in oil prices.
    • Cut to Neutral from Overweight: Devon Energy (NYSE:DVN), Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR), Matador Resources (NYSE:MTDR) and SCR Energy (NYSEMKT:SRCI).
    • Downgraded to Underweight from Neutral, in addition to CHK: Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) and Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK).
    • Cut by two notches to Underweight from Overweight: Extraction Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:XOG) and High Point Resources (NYSE:HPR).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 55 Comments
  • APHA

    Short seller Citron likes Aphria, sees 70% upside; shares up 7%

    • Pot stock Aphria (APHA +7%) is up on robust turnover of almost 20M shares on the heels of Altria Group's 45% stake in Cronos Group.
    • Adding a bit of fuel to the buying is a bullish call from heretofore-short seller Citron Research who says Altria's action warrants a "rethink" on pot stock valuations, adding that APHA is a compelling candidate considering its large Canadian footprint and fair value target of $10 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 129 Comments
  • K

    Kellogg partners on cornflakes-beer mashup

    • Kellogg (K -0.7%) is teaming up with UK's Seven Bro7thers Brewery to convert extra cornflakes into a beer called Throw Away IPA.
    • The cornflakes are added during the mash up process and end up accounting for about 30% of the grain content of the beer.
    • Though small in scale, the company sees the partnership as a sustainable way to reduce food waste.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • ULTA

    Wells Fargo's read on Ulta Beauty

    • Wells Fargo sticks with an Outperform rating on Ultra Beauty (ULTA -9.7%) after taking in the retailer's Q3 earnings report and conference call.
    • "Management sounded cautiously optimistic heading into the thick of the holiday season (noting that the competitive environment is robust but stable), while we remain confident in ULTA's ability to deliver comps in their targeted range as they begin to lever FY18 investments next year," writes analyst Ike Boruchow and team.
    • "We believe investors should keep their eye on the long-term path today, as we continue to regard ULTA as a best-in-class retailer."
    • Wells has a 2018 EPS estimate of $10.88 on ULTA and 2019 EPS estimate of $12.62. WF's price target of $328 on Ulta is 22X the firm's 2020 EPS estimate.
    • Previously: Ulta Beauty beats by $0.02, revenue in-line (Dec. 6)
    • Previously: Comp sales up 8% at Ulta Beauty (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 4 Comments
  • TNXP

    Tonix Pharma prices equity offering; shares down 5%

    • Investors now know the reason behind the early jump in Tonix Pharmaceuticals (TNXP -5.1%). The company has priced its $15M public offering of Class A Units at $3.50 each and Class B Units at $1,000 each.
    • Each Class A Unit consists of one share of common stock and one five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $3.50.
    • Each Class B Unit consists of one share of Series A Convertible Preferred Stock, convertible into 286 common shares, valued at $1,000 per share and five-year warrants to purchase 286 common shares at $3.50.
    • Yesterday's close was $3.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • TENX

    Cronos Group and Aphria among healthcare gainers; Viveve Medical leads the losers

    • Gainers: Tenax Therapeutics (NASDAQ:TENX) +162%. Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding (NASDAQ:TNXP) +60%. Cronos Group (NASDAQ:CRON) +22%. Kodiak Sciences (NASDAQ:KOD) +11%. Aphria (NYSE:APHA) +10%.
    • Losers: Viveve Medical (NASDAQ:VIVE) -25%. Oragenics (NYSEMKT:OGEN) -15%. MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG) -10%. Fresenius Medical Care (NYSE:FMS) -9%. NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:NBY) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • EQNR

    Equinor’s Troll expansion project gets government OK

    • Equinor (EQNR +2.8%) says it has received approval from Norway's government for its plan to increase production and extend the lifetime of the Troll offshore oil and gas field.
    • EQNR says the NOK7.8B ($915M) Phase 3 development will help to produce an extra 2.2B boe and extend gas production beyond 2050.
    • “With a break-even of less than $10/bbl, Troll Phase 3 is one of the most profitable and resilient projects ever in our company,” says the company's senior VP for the project.
    • The field accounts for ~40% of the natural gas reserves on the Norwegian continental shelf and meets 7%-8% of Europe’s consumption.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • HCM

    Small healthcare stocks shrug off broad market selling

    • Money flow has picked over the past two weeks in micro/small cap healthcare stocks after the recent selloff. Many will need to raise new capital in 2019, however.
    • A sampling of today's action: (HCM +4.6%)(IVC +6.9%)(ABEO +2.8%)(ADMP +4.3%)(AGLE +2.6%)(GNMX +8.4%)(ALIM +4.5%)(BDSI +2.7%)(BCLI +3.3%)(CFRX +5.8%)(CNCE +2.6%)(CDTX +0.8%)(CBMG +3.9%)(APOP +6.8%)(CYAD +5.9%)(CATB +5.9%)(CLBS +2.1%)(OSIR +3.2%)(OASM +3.9%)(OHRP +4.3%)(NVAX +2.5%)(MBOT +7.4%)(MNKD +4.6%)(MEIP +4.3%)(LJPC +5.3%)(OTCQB:IMNP +4.4%)(MRUS +4.7%)(LPCN +1.8%)(ITCI +9.2%)(HEB +3.1%)(CRBP +5.1%)(ISR +3.7%)(TNXP +60.3%)(TTNP +12.3%)(TENX +159.5%)(SNSS +6.8%)(SNES +3.5%)(REPH +3.3%)(PULM +5.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 21 Comments
  • CLDC

    China Lending Corporation launches new supply chain financing services

    • China Lending Corporation (CLDC +9.4%) says that the company has expanded its service offerings with the launch of its new supply chain financing services including business factoring program.
    • The Program aims to provide owners of SMEs with liquidity to finance operations and growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • SOI

    Solaris Oilfield +5% after initiating dividend

    • Solaris Oilfield Infrastructure (SOI +4.7%) shoots higher after declaring its first quarterly cash dividend of $0.10/share, to be paid on Dec. 27 to holders of record as of Dec. 17.
    • Solaris says the move reflects confidence that it has "reached a scale where we can begin to return cash to our shareholders while also continuing to invest in our growth and preserve our conservative balance sheet."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • EIX

    Edison lifts dividend, still probing involvement in Southern California wildfire

    • Edison International (EIX +2.1%) moves higher after raising its quarterly dividend to $0.6125/share from $0.605 and releasing its latest incident report on last month's Woolsey Fire to California regulators.
    • In its evaluation of whether a power failure near the start of the Woolsey Fire was related to contact between wires, Southern California Edison said its crews found a guy wire, used to support power poles, near a jumper, which connects two energized lines, at a circuit that failed ahead of the blaze, but no live wires were found on the ground at the site.
    • California investigators have not determined the cause of the Woolsey Fire, and EIX also has not determined the cause of the outage on its circuit.
    • SoCal Edison is facing increased scrutiny for the wildfire that burned ~100K acres and destroyed 1,500 structures in and around Malibu last month; EIX shares have dropped 17% since the Nov. 8 start of the Southern California fire.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 4 Comments

  • Natural gas inventory declines in-line with estimates

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -63 Bcf vs. -64 Bcf consensus, -59 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +3.05% to $4.459.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL en
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 13 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez -3.7% post Q3 results

    • Zumiez (ZUMZ -3.7%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 1.2% Y/Y to $248.8M & 4.8% increase in comparable sales.
    • Gross margin increased 100 bps Y/Y to 34.9% & Operating margin dropped 25 bps to 7.4%.
    • The Company had cash and current marketable securities of $127.9M (+49.1% Y/Y).
    • The Company has opened 12 new stores this year, including 5 stores in North America; 7 stores in Europe & plan to open one more store in 2018.
    • 4Q 2018 Outlook: Net sales of $295-301M; EPS of $1.02-1.08; comparable sale to grow 0-2%.
    • Previously: Zumiez beats by $0.10, revenue in-line (Dec. 06 2018)

  • HOV

    Home Purchasing Sentiment Index gains half a point in November

    • Fannie Mae November Home Purchasing Sentiment Index  creeps up 0.5 points to 86.2, as survey participants' household incomes gained offsetting potential cooling factors in the housing market.
    • "Consumers' perceptions of growth in their household income reached a survey high this month, helping to absorb some of the impact of increasing mortgage rates on housing market activity," says Fannie Mae Chief Economist Doug Duncan.
    • iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF (BATS:ITB) jumps 1.4%.
    • The net share of those who say their household income is significantly higher than it was a year ago rose 5 percentage points M/M to a survey high of 24%.
    • Net share of Americans who say it's a good time to buy a home rose 2 pp to 23%.
    • The net share of those who say home prices will go up fell by 4 pp to 33%, down for the second straight month.
    • Among individual stocks: Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV +3.4%), Lennar (LEN +2.7%), William Lyon Homes (WLH +2.5%), Beazer Homes (BZH +1.3%),  KB Homes (KBH +2.6%), PulteGroup (PHM +1.1%).
    • Previously: Homebuilders, timber REITs gain as mortgage rates slip (Dec. 6)

  • U.S. crude oil +5% as OPEC reportedly reaches production cut deal

    • Crude oil futures are now surging on reports that OPEC has struck a deal to cut production: WTI +4.9% to $54.03/bbl, Brent +5.2% to $63.19/bbl.
    • Iraq's oil minister says OPEC members agree to cut ~800K bbl/day with non-OPEC allies including Russia asked to cut 400K bbl/day for combined reductions of 1.2M bbl/day, with October oil output as the deal's baseline; the agreement will last for six months, to be reviewed in April.
    • Iran was granted an exemption from the cuts since it is under sanctions from the U.S.; Libya and Venezuela also are exempt.

    Fiat to make new Grand Cherokee in Detroit

    • There's more information out on Fiat Chrysler Automobile's (NYSE:FCAU) plans in Detroit.
    • The automaker plans to convert the Mack Avenue Engine II plant in the city to manufacture a new three-row Jeep Grand Cherokee for model year 2021, sources tell The Detroit News. Construction is expected to start next year.
    • Fiat's plans in Detroit follow shortly after General Motor's (NYSE:GM) announcement that it would be idling four U.S. plants.
